result.execSummary:
The defendant Chrystopher J Verba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chrystopher J Verba is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chrystopher J Verba was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final pre-trial at 02-09-2016 02:30 pm
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; Atty Cornia offers input for signature bond; ADA Helmberger argues for cash bail; Ct modifies bond; Ct adjourned.

CASH BOND SET WITH REFERRAL TO BMP 
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Dennis B. or Francesco A.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ronald P.
- Defendant shall continue working toward obtaining his GED.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Craig A., William G., or Frencesco A.
- Defendant shall be within his residence between the hours of 6 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment.
Trial Judge - Br 12
Bail/bond hearing at 12-18-2015 02:15 pm

Referral to bail monitoring.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; Atty Cornia requests bail modification and requests that this case join 15CF173; ADA Shimabuku offers input; Ct does referral to BMP w/added conditions(same as in 15CF173)

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND  REFERRAL TO BMP AND CONDITIONS ADDED FROM 15CF173
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.  
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500 (per case), as cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Dennis B. or Francesco A.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Ronald P.
- Defendant shall continue working toward obtaining his GED.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Craig A., William G., or Frencesco A.
- Defendant shall be within his residence between the hours of 6 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment.
Trial Judge - Br 12
Bail continued.
File sent to Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
